meanings.definition: A track or road on which tramcars or trucks run, especially one laid with rails.
meanings.sent1: The workers loaded the coal onto the tramroads for transportation to the factory.
meanings.sent2: The city invested in expanding the tramroads to improve public transportation.
meanings.sent3: The tramcars had a race on the tramroads, and it was quite a sight to see!
meanings.sent4: The tramroads of progress were laid out before them, promising a brighter future.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the tramcars rumbling along the tramroads echoed through the valley.

meanings.sent1: The old town was connected to the neighboring villages through the tramroads.
meanings.sent2: The tramroads were essential for the efficient movement of goods in the region.
meanings.sent3: The tramroads system was so well-organized that it seemed like a giant puzzle.
meanings.sent4: In the web of tramroads, each line represented a different route to success.
meanings.sent5: The tramroads network crisscrossed the city, linking every corner with ease.
